remarks: Universal property of the Cartesian product considered as a categorical product in the category of sets.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Dec-2014.)
statement:
upxp.1 $e |- P = ( 1st |` ( B X. C ) ) $.
upxp.2 $e |- Q = ( 2nd |` ( B X. C ) ) $.
upxp $p |- ( ( A e. D /\ F : A --> B /\ G : A --> C ) -> E! h ( h : A --> ( B X. C ) /\ F = ( P o. h ) /\ G = ( Q o. h ) ) ) $.
$d A h $.
$d B h $.
$d C h $.
$d D h $.
$d F h $.
$d G h $.
